data.title: Emerson School
data.meta_description: Emerson has a passionate, seasoned faculty and staff. Teachers intimately know their students—what makes them tick, when to challenge, and when to hold back—and they’re empowered to adjust the pace and content of their classes based on the readiness and interests of their children. Learn more.
data.text:
BS University of Wisconsin,

JD John Marshall Law School (University of Illinois-Chicago)

dfeldman@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2023

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

I am drawn to this community’s commitment to being child-centered in its approach to teaching and learning

In one word, what is your working style?

Reflective

How would students describe you?

Engaged, someone who loves what they teach, how they teach, and most importantly who they teach.

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

Time – I want to read more, learn more, and explore more

Favorite artist or band?

The Beatles

What would surprise people about you?

Until I was 19, I was certain I would be a professional baseball player.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Anything that’s not blue

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Tom Hanks

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Education is not a preparation for life, it’s life itself.” John Dewey

B.A., Purdue University

azimmer@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2003

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

The welcoming community and opportunity to work in an environment that supports innovation and creativity were both big draws for me as a young teacher.

What wows you about Emerson School?

A group of faculty that will do ANYTHING for students.

In one word, what is your working style?

Energetic.

How would students describe you?

Fun, an advocate for them, a basketball trick shot magician

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

The ability to teleport so I could easily travel around the world.

Favorite artist or band?

Various podcasts.

What would surprise people about you?

I love to cross-country ski (skating style) and do yoga every morning.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

Spend time with my wife and three kids, go mountain biking, and follow Michigan sports.

Who/what inspires you?

The desire to treat my students as I would want my own kids treated by the adults in their school life.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Anything with peanut butter cups.

Kalamazoo College, BA

apatton@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2020

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

When I first worked at Emerson school, it was because I found a job working in the after care program to help me save up, move out to New York City, and work in publishing. I made it out there and found that, although I was right where I’d wanted to be, I couldn’t stop thinking about my experiences with the kids and teachers at Emerson school. I started taking my vacation days to go back and teach summer camps, then decided I wanted to become an educator. In short, Emerson’s unique environment was the place I was meant to be and the curious, hilarious, compassionate students here are the reason I wanted to teach.

In one word, what is your working style?

Creative

How would students describe you?

Goofy, weird, and my students’ biggest cheerleader

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

Teleportation

Favorite artist or band?

Crossbow

What would surprise people about you?

I’ve had the same best friend since I was four years old!

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I love to sing, read, play games, and spend time with animals.

Who/what inspires you?

I’m inspired by my favorite books and stories, like “Little Women,” “Rocky,” and “Wayside School.” I’m also inspired by our librarian, Linda!

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales.” ~paraphrased from Albert Einstein

B.A., California State University Northridge

rbecker@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2022

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

Emerson is an established school that aligns with my beliefs as an educator, while providing room to grow and evolve as the world around us keeps changing.

In one word, what is your working style?

Passionate

How would students describe you?

Fun uncle mixed with a supportive ally of their gifts… someone who really “sees” them.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

Play outside with my family and friends as much as possible, from hiking to camping to sports to stewarding the land.

Who/what inspires you?

The youth I am fortunate enough to serve. Resilient young humans!

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Seth Rogen

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

Coincidentally, my favorite quote is a Ralph Waldo Emerson classic…

“What you ARE shouts so loudly in my ears that I cannot hear what you are saying.”

B.F.A., Eastern Michigan University

jbeckerleg@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2019

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

Every single time I stepped through the doors of Emerson leading up to my employment I left feeling inspired. I was inspired by the passion of the teachers and staff and the genuine kindness of everyone I came across. When the opportunity to use my skills to support such an amazing place presented itself, I jumped at the chance to join the team.

What wows you about Emerson School?

They embrace curiosity in a way I have never seen anywhere else.

In one word, what is your working style?

Creative

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

The ability to travel through time so I could travel back to different key times in musical history and see all of the bands I never had the chance to see.

Favorite artist or band?

New Order

What would surprise people about you?

I am an avid collector of vinyl records. I’ve been collecting since I was about 15 years old.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I like to spend time with my wife and kids outdoors. I also really enjoy going to see live music when I get a chance.

Who/what inspires you?

I am inspired by nature and anyone not afraid to express themselves creatively.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Ben & Jerry’s Karamel Sutra

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Jack Black

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Creativity is intelligence having fun.” ~Albert Einstein

B.A., University of California, Los Angeles

M.S., San Jose State University

cberkley@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2001

What wows you about Emerson?

How much the faculty and staff care about students’ wellbeing.

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

To transport myself instantly with the snap of a finger. Because I would be able to get so much more accomplished in a day. But, this might also be because I watched reruns of “Bewitched” when I was a child.

What would surprise people about you?

I spent my childhood running around the desert, picking up creatures, climbing trees, playing and squabbling with my numerous siblings and going barefoot as much as possible.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

Coach cross country, run with my dog, cycle, CrossFit, garden, cook, bake, quilt and read.

Who/what inspires you?

Nature. Anyone who persists in the face of adversity.

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Everyone you meet is fighting a battle you know nothing about. Be kind.”

Bachelor’s in English, University of Michigan

Master’s in Elementary Education, University of Washington

sbernhardt@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2023

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

To be a part of a school that is a place of deep learning

What wows you about Emerson?

The people who work here truly love this school!

In one word, what is your working style?

Calm, thoughtful, intentional

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

To be able to make sure that everyone on the planet has what they need

Favorite artist or band?

Mumford & Sons

What would surprise people about you?

I have lived and taught in China, Vietnam, Oman, Japan, and Latvia

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

Hike in the woods, kayak, read, and watch my two boys play baseball

Who/what inspires you?

Teachers who look at learning in a fresh, new way

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Mint chocolate chip

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Making mathematics a subject that all children and teachers love is completely within our reach.” ~Elham Kazemi

B.A., Olivet College

mborton@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

1994

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

I was looking for a part-time band director position, in the newspaper- which by the way is very rare to find. Why did I stay? The community: students, colleagues and parents!

What wows you about Emerson School?

I am truly amazed by the staff members at Emerson. We have such creative and passionate people that work here. I feel very lucky to be a part of this team!

In one word, what is your working style?

ENTHUSIASTIC! : ) <3

How would students describe you?

Caring, funny, passionate, creative, silly, family, on occasion LOUD

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

I would want the ability to manipulate time so I could slow down time to really enjoy special moments in the day as well as getting in a good nap.

Favorite artist or band?

Michael Buble – amazing in concert!

What would surprise people about you?

I was one of the first Spartan Marching Band members that helped start the tradition of “Sparty Watch.” The week before MSU plays U of M, the SMB members guard Sparty – it’s now a huge event, with DJ’s, movies, the Sparty mascot and visits by the current coaches.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I love being outside in nature, spending time with family and friends. I enjoy being creative and trying new things that take me (a little) out of my comfort zone.

Who/what inspires you?

My family. We may face challenges in life but we play the hand that we are dealt to the best of our abilities.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Cherry Garcia – Yum!

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Melissa McCarthy – wow, that would be amazing and so much fun to watch!

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Live a life of love, honesty, appreciation, kindness and strength…sprinkled with a little silliness.” “Fake it ’til ya make it!” “Hey band! Hey what! Show me how to get down. B A N D that’s the way to get down!”

Bachelor of Science in Business, Marketing & Human Resources

kburgess@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2022

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

I wanted to work at school where my values aligned with the mission of the school and the colleagues I work with. Emerson is a perfect fit- I love the personal approach we take to educating our students and providing them with the tools they need to be successful in life- not just how to be good scholars!

What wows you about Emerson?

The opportunities for growth and development- for EVERY member of our community!

In one word, what is your working style?

Passionate!

How would students describe you?

Friendly, playful, always willing to help!

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

To freeze time for everyone else while I kept going- there is never enough time for me to get my work done!!

Favorite artist or band?

Odesza!

What would surprise people about you?

A LOT 🙂

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I love to hike, garden, spend time with my husband and pets, and watch sports! Primarily women’s sports, but I do love college football (GO IRISH!) and will always root for the home teams (Lions/Tigers/Wings/Pistons)!

Who/what inspires you?

Children! to look at the world with such curiosity and innocence inspires me to take things far less seriously & to see the magic in every day. Also, my mom- she was a phenomenal educator for over 20 years- I hope to leave half the impact she made on her students one day.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Graeter’s Black Raspberry Chocolate Chip

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Jennifer Lawrence

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Being different isn’t a bad thing. It means you’re brave enough to be yourself.” ~Luna Lovegood

B.M.E., University of Michigan

lcapozzo@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2002

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

To work with Emerson’s incredible students and families

What wows you about Emerson?

The way in which children welcome new students

In one word, what is your working style?

Passionate

How would students describe you?

I hope as both their coach and cheerleader

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

To grow the world’s tastiest vegetables (and then feed the world)

Favorite artist or band?

Beethoven and The Cure

What would surprise people about you?

The daughter of a builder, I am personally renovating my home; pouring concrete, installing windows, and putting up siding. I am excited to be building a chicken coop in the backyard soon!

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I play violin in a symphony, walk my pups, kayak, and visit Greenfield Village.

Who/what inspires you?

My mentors and friends, music, art, and Emerson students

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Lavender

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Amy Poehler

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“People will forget what you said, people will forget what you did, but people will never forget how you make them feel.”

~ Maya Angelou

University of Wisconsin, Madison – B.S.,

Lesley University – M.Ed

dcarbone@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2022

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

I love that Emerson celebrates and appreciates the unique talents and gifts of each student. The collaborative and forward-thinking approach to education makes Emerson an ideal place to learn and teach.

Every time I visited the school, the staff and teachers were always friendly and the students were smiling and engaged. Visiting on the day of the bake sale and book sale was the perfect time to see Emerson shine!

What wows you about Emerson?

I love the design of the building which incorporates creative spaces like the theater and the outdoor learning areas. The new colleagues that I’m just getting to know are also impressive!

In one word, what is your working style?

Integrated

How would students describe you?

Creative, fun, passionate about books, and a little bit silly

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

I’d love to be able to fly. The ability to fly would be great for exploring the world and seeing nature from a whole new perspective.

Favorite artist or band?

Van Morrison

What would surprise people about you?

Since I grew up in Madison, Wisconsin, I’m a Badger fan.

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

We can’t always choose the music life plays for us, but we can choose how we dance to it. ~ Author unknown

Punjab University, Bachelors in Education

pchaudhary@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2021

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

I wanted a close-knit community that valued education and was able to give individual attention to students while also having a wide breadth and depth of experiences for faculty and students.

What wows you about Emerson?

I am amazed by the spirit and collegiality of the staff, and the amazing resources available.

In one word, what is your working style?

Pragmatic

How would students describe you?

I am easy to connect with but I also gently coach them to be the best they can be.

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

Multiply myself at will, so I can manage all the things I need to do at work and at home.

Favorite artist or band?

Coke studio artists (live music show )

What would surprise people about you?

Willing to learn about anything, especially other cultures

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

Taking care of my family and spending time with friends

Who/what inspires you?

I am inspired by those who are willing to push themselves beyond their comfort zone and accept the risk of failure. I find these folks show true grit and are whom I wish to emulate.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Butterscotch

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Sandra Bullock

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

Failure is not the opposite of success, it’s part of success

B.S., Eastern Michigan University

M.A., Marygrove College

echenier@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2014

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

I wanted to work at Emerson because it is an environment where students love to learn and be challenged. Emerson takes the whole child into consideration and celebrates students’ unique talents.

What wows you about Emerson School?

Emerson is a community that cares about each person involved in it. From the first time I walked through Emerson’s doors I knew it was a place I wanted to be.

In one word, what is your working style?

Creative.

How would students describe you?

Students say I am a fun-loving, energetic, horse-crazy “coffee-holic”, who loves her students as if they were her own kids.

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

I would be able to talk to animals as if they were people, wait, I already do that:)

Favorite artist or band?

Enya

What would surprise people about you?

When I was sixteen years old I was a puppeteer for a cable television show called The Gingerbread House. I also illustrated a middle school science textbook called Pollution and the Ozone Layer, my characters were called the Pew Patrol.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I love to play with my grandson Joseph and hang with my horses at the barn. I also love to paint.

Who/what inspires you?

Ron Clark, the teacher who won the Disney Teacher of the Year in 2000, inspires me. I watch his film, “The Ron Clark Story,” every year before school begins.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Pistachio.

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Stocker Channing

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Time flies whether you are having fun or not. The choice is yours.”

B.A., Eastern Michigan University

jdishman@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2021

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

The learning model, the people I’ve met, and the chance to enrich the lives of the students!

What wows you about Emerson?

The number of resources and the beautiful structure of the building!

In one word, what is your working style?

“Curiosity-driven”

How would students describe you?

Enthusiastic

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

Telekinesis, so that I could do even more at once!

Favorite artist or band?

Half Alive

What would surprise people about you?

I used to do murder mystery dinner theatre.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

Biking, video games, swing dance, dungeons and dragons, adoring my cat.

Who/what inspires you?

Inspiration can be extracted from anyone and anything through an open heart.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

It’s an even tie between ALL OF THEM

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Timothee Chalamet

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Hustle, don’t Hurry” ~Tiz Arrior

nflautner@emerson-school.org

MPH from George Washington University

MA in Health and Behavior Studies from Teachers College Columbia University

BA from St. Olaf College in Physical Education

What year did you start at Emerson?

2024

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

To be part of a community that’s on a mission to figure out how to do 21st century education best.

What wows you about Emerson?

The students! It was clear to me from day 1.

In one word, what is your working style?

Creative.

How would students describe you?

Friendly and passionate.

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

Apparate/Teleport so I could explore any place in the world, yet still be back at Emerson the next morning.

Favorite artist or band?

Depends on my mood! For running – Faithless. For daydreaming – Balazs Havasi. When I need to think things through – Brandi Carlile.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I love to travel, play tennis, listen to podcasts, and hang out with my husband and 4 daughters, plus one puppy.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Ben and Jerry’s Half Baked

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Steffi Graf

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

Don’t believe everything you think.

University of Minnesota Twin-Cities- Ph.D.

gfajardo@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2022

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

I want to make a positive change in the education of young learners.

What wows you about Emerson?

The incredible community at Emerson!

In one word, what is your working style?

Creative

How would students describe you?

As a fun and energetic teacher!

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

I would love to be able to read as fast as possible!

Favorite artist or band?

Blink-182

What would surprise people about you?

I finish law school in Mexico! And I know how to juggle.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I am a fiction writer, so I will be writing novels and short stories. I also enjoy running!

Who/what inspires you?

Any fiction writer that mastered his or her craft.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Vanilla

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Paul Giamatti or Jake Gyllenhaal

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

A quote from English critic Cyril Connolly: “Better to write for yourself and have no public, than to write for the public and have no self.”

Master’s Degree in Music Performance, University of Michigan

dgabrion@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2022

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

As a native Ann Arborite and I’ve heard for years about the amazing learning community at Emerson and how wonderful it is to be part of this community. I’m thrilled for the opportunity to work with the awesome Emerson staff and students.

What wows you about Emerson?

I am impressed by the strong fine arts and language programs at Emerson as well as the kind and generous people who work there. Also, the library is pretty cool.

In one word, what is your working style?

Collaborative

How would students describe you?

They seem to think I’m a good singer (I’m not).

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

It’s not a superpower but I would love to be tall so that I could reach things on high (and even medium high) shelves.

Favorite artist or band?

Spanish guitarist Paco de Lucia

What would surprise people about you?

I raise butterflies in my spare time.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I play the harp professionally. And, I have lots of gardens focused on butterflies, native plants, and collecting the rain that runs off of my house.

Who/what inspires you?

The children I work with constantly surprise and inspire me.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Almond Joy

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Experience first, then intellectualize.” – Carl Orff

Central Michigan University – BS in Physical Education & MA in PE/Athletic Administration

mglennie@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2022

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

Have heard so much about the special community at Emerson.

In one word, what is your working style?

Engaging

How would students describe you?

Caring and Fun

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

To Fly! I would be able to see the world and travel anytime I wanted.

Favorite artist or band?

Just about any country!

What would surprise people about you?

When I am at home I have an 8 lb. dog named Champ who is glued to me wherever I go.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

Biking, coaching football, watching our son play baseball, and spending time with my wife and kids.

Who/what inspires you?

God & People who are giving and compassionate to others.

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

If it’s worth doing, it’s worth doing right!

CSU, Chico B.A. Liberal Studies, M.S. Education: Curriculum and Instruction

jhoag@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2019

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

After meeting the faculty, staff, and students at Emerson I knew that this was my new home. The teachers put the individual student first and ensure that they are set-up for success. The students enjoy being active, engaging with each other, and love having fun!

What wows you about Emerson School?

My colleagues.

In one word, what is your working style?

Collaborative

How would students describe you?

Kind, goofy, and determined

If you could have one superpower, what would it be?

Heal hurt with the blink of an eye

Favorite artist or band?

I don’t have a favorite, I appreciate all music and love to listen to it all.

What would surprise people about you?

That although I was born and raised in California, I grew up in the snow.

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

Explore Michigan with my twin boys or attend UofM sporting events

Who/what inspires you?

My mom because of her work ethic and my 4-year-old boys for their love of learning.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Mint chip

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Lisa Kudrow

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“The only true failure is the failure to try”

Hillsdale College, B.A.

chughes@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

I was a Summer at Emerson counselor 2015-2018 and began subbing in 2021, but 2022 will be my first time back full-time since I started as a student in 2006!

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

Emerson has been a home to me in one way or another for 15+ years. It’s where I learned to love school when I was a student, and more recently, it’s where I’ve discovered how much I love working in Education. The passion and kindness of this community is so energizing and inspiring! There’s nowhere else I’d rather be to dive into this field and no other students and coworkers I’d rather do it with!

What wows you about Emerson?

How dedicated the students, teachers, and staff all are, not only to learning and to inviting each other to grow academically and emotionally, but also to creating and fostering a supportive, inclusive, healthy, and fun(!) environment to do so in.

In one word, what is your working style?

Active!

How would students describe you?

Relentlessly upbeat and always on my toes

Favorite artist or band?

Artist: Mark Rothko, Band: The Killers

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I help coach lacrosse at Pioneer High School, and I love doing trivia nights around town with friends, spending time with my family Up North, and watching Michigan sports

Who/what inspires you?

Those with the courage to accept or ask for help, and those who are able to notice the need and respond to it. For me, that second group has often included teachers and coaches, and always my mom.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Blank Slate’s Garden Mint Chip

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

Kristen Bell (I’d wish!)

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

« Aimer, c’est agir » or, “To love is to act” –Victor Hugo

B.A., Hillsdale College

Graduate Classes from Eastern Michigan

khughes@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2013

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

My children attended Emerson for middle school (Claire came in 5th grade). I quickly realized what a special place Emerson was.

What wows you about Emerson School?

The way the teachers, the staff, the families and the student’s work together to form a warm learning community.

In one word, what is your working style?

Creative

How would students describe you?

My student’s always enjoy the stories I share with them.

Favorite artist or band?

Harry Connick Jr.

What would surprise people about you?

I am deathly afraid of snakes!

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I love to spend time with my family at our family cottage up north. I also enjoy boating, reading, golfing and traveling. Attending anything musical with my daughter is also a favorite way to spend my time.

Who/what inspires you?

My faith inspires me to strive to be the best person I can be.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

Raspberry Sorbet

B.A., University College of Ripon and York St. John

M.A., Eastern Michigan University

ckelly@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2011

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

There’s a whole story involving Facebook, maternity leave, and having just got my Green Card. Essentially, I came for the entertainment and stayed for the people.

What wows you about Emerson School?

It’s my safe place.

In one word, what is your working style?

Inclusive

How would students describe you?

“Lessons were never boring”

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

A way to fit in about 3 days into every 24 hours – there’s always so many things I want to do.

Favorite artist or band?

Pink Floyd (that ages me)

What would surprise people about you?

alawrence@emerson-school.org

What year did you start at Emerson?

2018

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

My own children have attended Emerson since Kindergarten in 2011, so I have seen firsthand the benefits of Emerson’s creative, joyful environment for kids. I wanted to be part of this nurturing team that helps to grow well-rounded, thoughtful humans!

In one word, what is your working style?

Thoughtful and compassionate. Oops, that’s two words. My working style apparently also involves pushing boundaries and limits. 😉

How would students describe you?

They often describe me as supportive, kind, approachable, and able to make the awkward moments in Health class actually sort of fun!

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

I can usually be found belting out Broadway show tunes in my car while driving my kids places, or capturing moments of beauty or silliness from behind my camera. I also seem to spend a lot of time retrieving socks and other inedible objects from my puppy’s mouth.

Who/what inspires you?

People who work bravely for social justice even when their friends, neighbors, or family do not.

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“The possibilities of where you can leverage your privilege to make real, measurable change toward a better world are endless. Every day you are given opportunities to make the world better, by making yourself a little uncomfortable and asking, ‘who doesn’t have this same freedom or opportunity that I’m enjoying now?’ These daily interactions are how systems of oppression are maintained, but with awareness, they can be how we tear those systems down. So please, check your privilege. Check it often.” – Ijeoma Oluo, “So You Want to Talk About Race”

tmattea@emerson-school.org

A.B. in Political Science from Washington University in St. Louis, 2011

M.A. in Education from Stanford University in 2012

What year did you start at Emerson?

2024

Why did you want to work at Emerson?

I was drawn to Emerson’s commitment to a progressive, whole-child approach to education that fosters creativity, curiosity, and lifelong learning. It felt like a natural fit not only for me but for our son, Emerson. I was so excited for him to start his educational journey here just as I was returning to teaching after five years as a stay-at-home dad. Plus, the fact that Emerson shares a name with the school is a fun bonus!

What wows you about Emerson?

Emerson’s strong sense of community, emphasis on collaboration, and supportive administrative team all stand out to me.

In one word, what is your working style?

Enthusiastic

How would students describe you?

My students would describe me as fun, engaging, and supportive. They’d say I make learning enjoyable through creative projects and humor, while helping them develop practical skills.

If you could have one superpower, what would it be and why?

If I could have one superpower, I’d choose clairvoyance. The ability to see beyond the present moment could help me make better decisions and understand situations more fully.

Favorite artist or band?

I’m really into disco, classic soul and R&B, and classic rock. I enjoy listening to the Bee Gees, Bill Withers, Kool & the Gang, Paul McCartney and Wings, and the Eagles. According to Spotify, I was in the top 1% of all KC & the Sunshine Band listeners in the world!

What would surprise people about you?

People might be surprised to learn I’m a bit of a history detective as well as a former game show champion. I’ve traced my family tree back several generations. In 2022, I found a century-old portrait of a sea captain in our attic and was able to locate his closest surviving relative and mail it to him in Canada. In 2021, I competed on the Game Show Network program, “Get a Clue,” with my college friends, and we won $10,000!

What do you do when you’re not at Emerson?

When I’m not at Emerson, I enjoy tackling home improvement projects and building Legos with my son. We recently used online instructions to build a transformable Power Rangers Megazord, and we’re currently making plans to build a minifig-scale model of our house.

Who/what inspires you?

I’m inspired by Ron Berger and his approach to teaching through critique and project-based learning. I’ve experienced firsthand how his emphasis on producing high-quality student work for authentic audiences through iteration and service transforms students. By following his example, my students have published picture books, helped select their school lunch provider, and registered and informed voters ahead of local elections.

What is your favorite ice cream flavor?

My go-tos are either an Oreo Blizzard or a hot fudge sundae whenever we venture to the Dairy Queen down the street from our house. I’m also a big fan of coffee, dulce de leche, cookie dough, and gooey butter cake ice cream flavors.

If a movie were made about you, who would be cast to play you?

I’ve had people tell me I remind them of a lot of different actors—but the consensus choice would probably be Jason Schwartzman.

Favorite quote, or anything else you would like Emerson families to know about you?

“Live a creative life!” ~ Spotted on a Hobby Lobby tractor-trailer (love the quote, though it’s not an endorsement of their political advocacy)

M.A. Drama/Theatre for the Young (Educational Theatre), Eastern Michigan University

Emerson is extraordinary for it’s extremely diverse educational process. I believe the students are fortunate to be exposed to so many varied teaching styles in one place.

Creative

White Chocolate Rasberry Truffle Hagan Daz
